manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Long-Description: Provides a tight integration of Apache JMeter (2.4) into NB infrastructure. This plugin will install additional plugins - "Load Generator" and "Profiler / Load Generator Bridge"
manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Module-Dependencies: org.netbeans.modules.loadgenerator/1 > 1.6, org.netbeans.modules.projectapi/1 > 1.13, org.netbeans.modules.projectuiapi/1 > 1.24, org.openide.awt > 6.11, org.openide.dialogs > 7.8, org.openide.explorer > 6.11, org.openide.filesystems > 7.0, org.openide.io > 1.11, org.openide.loaders > 5.11, org.openide.modules > 7.2, org.openide.nodes > 6.9, org.openide.text > 6.16, org.openide.util > 8.0, org.openide.util.lookup > 8.0, org.openide.windows > 6.8

manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Long-Description: This kit presents a high level module for easy installation of the JMeter load generator system into NetBeans IDE It will install also the following modules: * LoadGenerator * JMeter Module * Load Generator -> Profiler Bridge
manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Module-Dependencies: org.apache.jmeter.module/1, org.netbeans.modules.loadgenerator/1, org.netbeans.modules.profiler.loadgen/1

manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Long-Description: Provides a generic loadgenerator infastructure. Enables a unified access to all loadgenerator engines registered in the system.
manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Module-Dependencies: org.netbeans.api.progress/1 > 1.8, org.netbeans.core.ide/1 > 1.15, org.netbeans.modules.projectapi/1 > 1.12, org.netbeans.modules.projectuiapi/1 > 1.24, org.netbeans.modules.queries/1 > 1.10, org.openide.actions > 6.6, org.openide.filesystems > 7.0, org.openide.io > 1.11, org.openide.loaders > 6.6, org.openide.modules > 7.2, org.openide.nodes > 7.23, org.openide.util > 8.0, org.openide.util.lookup > 8.0

manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Long-Description: The CVS Client Library module implements the client side of CVS server connection. Local connections are not supported.
manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Short-Description: A CVS client library, that substitutes the client side of the native CVS executable.
